channel.title: On the Ledge
channel.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
channel.description: News and insight on stories in The Clarion-Ledger and on clarionledger.com, the No. 1 information source in Mississippi.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Mississippi news and insight from The Clarion-Ledger
channel.itunes:summary: News and insight on stories in The Clarion-Ledger and on clarionledger.com, the No. 1 information source in Mississippi.

item.title: On the Ledge - Friday March 27, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Tornadoes cause destruction in central Mississippi, Jackson Mayor Frank Melton gets his name back on the re-election ballot and the legislative session draws to a close.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tornadoes cause destruction in central Mississippi, Jackson Mayor Frank Melton gets his name back on the re-election ballot and the legislative session draws to a close.

item.title: On the Ledge - Thursday March 26, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: A texting and driving bill heads to the governor, some candidates for Jackson mayor defend why they haven't paid taxes on time in the past and Rankin County builds a new shopping center.
item.itunes:subtitle: A texting and driving bill heads to the governor, some candidates for Jackson mayor defend why they haven't paid taxes on time in the past and Rankin County builds a new shopping center.

item.title: On the Ledge - Sunday March 22, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: A TSA loophole leaves room for weapons on planes and Jackson Mayor Frank Melton gets a compromise in his run for re-election.
item.itunes:subtitle: A TSA loophole leaves room for weapons on planes and Jackson Mayor Frank Melton gets a compromise in his run for re-election.

item.title: On the Ledge - Friday March 20, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Crime platforms for mayoral candidates, the College Board meeting and new assessment tools in the works for public schools
item.itunes:subtitle: Crime platforms for mayoral candidates, the College Board meeting and new assessment tools in the works for public schools

item.title: On the Ledge - Thursday March 19, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: St. Patrick's Day festivities and Jackson Mayor Frank Melton is disqualified from running again.
item.itunes:subtitle: St. Patrick's Day festivities and Jackson Mayor Frank Melton is disqualified from running again.

item.title: On the Ledge - Wednesday March 18, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Big turnout at a Jackson job fair and a meth lab discovery in South Jackson.
item.itunes:subtitle: Big turnout at a Jackson job fair and a meth lab discovery in South Jackson.

item.title: On the Ledge - Tuesday March 17, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Wrapping up the SEC tournament with sports reporter David Brandt and biz reporter Jeff Ayres previews today's massive job fair in Jackson. Oh, and the daily Melton trial update!
item.itunes:subtitle: Wrapping up the SEC tournament with sports reporter David Brandt and biz reporter Jeff Ayres previews today's massive job fair in Jackson. Oh, and the daily Melton trial update!
item.itunes:keywords: clarion,ledger,clarion-ledger,jackson,mississippi,sec basketball,mississippi state,ole miss,frank melton,jobs in mississippi

item.title: On the Ledge - Sunday March 15, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Cellular South expands it coverage, Mississippi takes another look at its Sunshine laws and Run From the Sun aims to spread awareness about melanoma.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cellular South expands it coverage, Mississippi takes another look at its Sunshine laws and Run From the Sun aims to spread awareness about melanoma.

item.title: On the Ledge - Friday March 13, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: JATRAN's budget woes, ousting of Hazlehurst schools' conservator and an MSU win in Tampa.
item.itunes:subtitle: JATRAN's budget woes, ousting of Hazlehurst schools' conservator and an MSU win in Tampa.

item.title: On the Ledge - Thursday March 12, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: A woman abandons her infant, Jackson mayoral candidates convene for a debate and the legislature reaches a deadline.
item.itunes:subtitle: A woman abandons her infant, Jackson mayoral candidates convene for a debate and the legislature reaches a deadline.

item.title: On the Ledge - Wednesday March 11, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: The state gets a bad grade in caring for the mentally ill and a decision is reached on the jury for the next trial of Mayor Frank Melton.
item.itunes:subtitle: The state gets a bad grade in caring for the mentally ill and a decision is reached on the jury for the next trial of Mayor Frank Melton.

item.title: On the Ledge - Tuesday March 10, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Biz reporter Jeff Ayres gets Motivated!, an AMA article has disturbing findings about violence against women in Mississippi after Katrina, and features writer Billy Watkins has the lowdown on Jasmine's appearance on American Idol tonight.
item.itunes:subtitle: Biz reporter Jeff Ayres gets Motivated!, an AMA article has disturbing findings about violence against women in Mississippi after Katrina, and features writer Billy Watkins has the lowdown on Jasmine's appearance on American Idol tonight.

item.title: On the Ledge - Sunday March 8, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Changes to the Hinds County court system, the Jackson mayor's effect on the school board and the field of candidates for local office.
item.itunes:subtitle: Changes to the Hinds County court system, the Jackson mayor's effect on the school board and the field of candidates for local office.

item.title: On the Ledge - Friday March 6, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Jackson Mayor Frank Melton will go to trial again, and JSU has a plan to build housing near campus.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jackson Mayor Frank Melton will go to trial again, and JSU has a plan to build housing near campus.

item.title: On the Ledge - Thursday March 5, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger

item.itunes:subtitle: The field of Jackson mayoral candidates and higher unemployment numbers in Mississippi.

item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger

item.itunes:subtitle: Death of voter ID legislation and stimulus funds for Jackson roads.

item.title: On the Ledge - Tuesday March 3, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Natalie Chandler discusses declining state revenue, Jerry Mitchell talks about the state's incarceration rate and Jimmie Gates discusses a sentencing in the death of a cyclist.
item.itunes:subtitle: Natalie Chandler discusses declining state revenue, Jerry Mitchell talks about the state's incarceration rate and Jimmie Gates discusses a sentencing in the death of a cyclist.
item.itunes:keywords: jimmie gates,cyclist accident,jerry mitchell,incarceration rate,natalie chandler,tax revenue,laraye brown

item.title: On the Ledge - Thursday Feb. 26, 2009
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Jimmie Gates talks about a man being paroled 22 years after killing an Ole Miss student. Blair Goldstein talks about the mayor's plan for the city to fund jobs for citizens and Natalie Chandler talks about state senators disdain for red light cameras.

item.title: On the Ledge - Friday Dec. 5, 2008
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Immigrants become U.S. citizens in Columbus, a surge in telephone touch-screen technology and a Baldwyn football coach overcomes a heart attack to lead his team to the championships.
item.itunes:subtitle: Immigrants become U.S. citizens in Columbus, a surge in telephone touch-screen technology and a Baldwyn football coach overcomes a heart attack to lead his team to the championships.

item.title: On the Ledge - Thursday Dec. 4, 2008
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: A new biolab plant seems unlikely to come to Mississippi, teachers are in short supply and the Chimneyville Crafts Festival begins.
item.itunes:subtitle: A new biolab plant seems unlikely to come to Mississippi, teachers are in short supply and the Chimneyville Crafts Festival begins.

item.title: On the Ledge - Wednesday Dec. 3, 2008
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Another possible child starvation death, update from Jackson City Hall and a report on the new convention center.
item.itunes:subtitle: Another possible child starvation death, update from Jackson City Hall and a report on the new convention center.

item.title: On the Ledge - Tuesday Dec. 2, 2008
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Mississippi reaction to Obama's cabinet picks, more crime in Jackson and credit unions rise in popularity.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mississippi reaction to Obama's cabinet picks, more crime in Jackson and credit unions rise in popularity.

item.title: On the Ledge - Sunday Nov. 30, 2008
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Cyber Monday, thrift store Christmas shopping, an update in the Mississippi Burning case, Jackson State security and homicides in the capital city.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cyber Monday, thrift store Christmas shopping, an update in the Mississippi Burning case, Jackson State security and homicides in the capital city.

item.title: On the Ledge - Thursday Nov. 27, 2008
item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger
item.description: Black Friday, wild dogs at the zoo and how to avoid family fights over politics this Thanksgiving make up this holiday edition of the podcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black Friday, wild dogs at the zoo and how to avoid family fights over politics this Thanksgiving make up this holiday edition of the podcast.

item.itunes:author: The Clarion-Ledger

item.itunes:subtitle: Sports Editor Rusty Hampton previews the Madison Central-South Panola game and reporter Jimmie Gates talks about a civil case that ended up jailing a 70-year-old man.
